In 2000 we waited more than a month to name a winner when the race was close in one state. Now we have multiple states that need more time to count and verify the votes. This is too important to get it wrong.
We the American people deserve better and must feel assured that our election process is honest and legitimate. (2/2)

Universal mail-in voting (sending every registered voter a ballot by mail whether they request it or not) has shaken many Americans' confidence in the election process. Many ballots went to wrong addresses and/or were never received at all leaving the door open to fraud. (1/2)
Some say they want all votes counted. I say we want all LEGAL votes counted. The difference is clear and critical.
Decision desks for major news networks do not determine who is #POTUS. The American people decide.

If there is nothing to hide why not continue the long standing practice of allowing poll watchers?  Uncertainty breeds distrust.  We deserve to have an electoral process that not only protects our most sacred right but is one that we can trust. https://t.co/qjeOmEgkOA

Our president is fighting for an honest fair election process. I stand firmly with him. There is too much at stake not to fully vet the votes.
We need more uniformity transparency and efficiency with our elections nationwide. This is ridiculous. (2/2)

Last week the House passed a bill providing more flexibility to small businesses that have received loans through the PPP. I supported this legislation b/c it addresses the varying needs of our Main Street job creators and ensures they can focus on getting back on their feet.

The Paycheck Protection Program (PPP) has provided much-needed relief to Tennessee – both businesses and employees. As our state begins to re-open I believe our small businesses need more flexibility in terms of their PPP loans.
